Tutorial¶

Follow the following steps:

  • set up Sphinx optional
    • install Sphinx (pip or conda are very convenient) -
    • initialize a docs folder (if not existing) by running sphinx-quickstart
  • create your Pyomo model
  • generate model documentation
    • import your model and pyomo_sphinx_docs.get_pyomo_model_docs()
    • pass your model to pyomo_sphinx_docs.get_pyomo_model_docs() and get the .rst documentation as a string
    • save to file
  • build your project documentation through Sphinx optional
    • add your file to the docs toctree
    • create your documentation by running make html
# import needed to create Pyomo model
from diet import create_model

from pyomo_sphinx_docs import get_pyomo_model_docs

model = create_model() # create model

docs = get_pyomo_model_docs(model) # get .rst docs as str

# save to file
with open("docs/diet_model.rst", "w") as f:
    f.write(docs)

In-line math¶

For in-line math, use the :math: directive.

Notice that since the docs are generated through strings, you need to escape backslashes, e.g. "\\alpha".

m.x = Var(m.F,
    within = pe.NonNegativeIntegers,
    doc = """Number of servings consumed of each food.
    :math:`x_f \\geq 0`""")

Multi-line math¶

For math blocks, use the .. math:: directive.

A few notes:

  • as all blocks directives, it must be preceded by an empty line. This can be achieved by adding an end-of-line character \n at the end of the previous line.
  • since the math block is a directive block, indentation matters: the math equation can be spread over multiple lines, but all lines after the first one must be indented.
m.total_volume = Expression(
    rule = lambda m: pe.summation(m.volume, m.x),
    doc = """Total volume of food consumed. \n
    .. math:: v^{tot} = \\sum_{f \\in \\mathcal{F}}
        v_f \\cdot x_f""")
